metadata.title: CVE-2023-31083 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/bluetooth/hci_ldisc.c in the Linuxkernel 6.2. In hci_uart_tty_ioctl, there is a race condition betweenHCIUARTSETPROTO and HCIUARTGETPROTO. HCI_UART_PROTO_SET is set beforehu->proto is set. A NULL pointer dereference may occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-lowlatency - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-aws - 4.4.0-1124.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.130').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1').
